subject: Cybersecurity
title: Tailgating: Walking Through Locked Doors
description: A short lesson to help you apply Tailgating: Walking Through Locked Doors.

hook.text: Someone holding coffee and a laptop bag walks behind you into a secure building. You hold the door open.

buildup.text: Tailgating means following an authorized person through a secured entrance without using credentials.

discovery.text: Most people won't challenge someone who looks like they belong. Social norms override security protocols.

twist.text: Pen testers report that tailgating works over 90% of the time. Politeness defeats badge readers.

climax.text: Physical security fails the moment someone feels rude for asking 'Can I see your badge?'

punchline.text: The door was locked. Politeness opened it.

quiz.question: What is tailgating in security?
options: Following an authorized person through a secured door
